results.title: Illustrations of radiation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Transference of Heat”.
Explains how heat sources emit radiations both as heat waves or infra-red waves and as light waves; how objects absorbing heat radiations rise in temperature; how heat is produced in glass-houses and how such glass-houses are cooled; explains the effects of clouds on radiation from the sun; shows how the shape of the earth results in different concentrations of the sun’s radiation at the poles and at the equator.

results.title: Illustrations of convection
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Transference of Heat”.
The film is divided into three parts: the first part shows convection in water as illustrated by the working of a central heating system and a motor coar cooling system. The second part shows convection in air with ventilation in a room with windows first open and then closed, as examples. The third part of the film illustrates the difference between a sea breeze and a land breeze.

results.title: Illustrations of conduction
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Transference of Heat”.
The film is divided into three parts: the first illustrates conduction in different substances, good and bad conductors and the insulation of a refrigerator; the second shows the method of lagging boilers and hot and cold pipes; the third shows various examples of poor heat conductors - wool, fur, feathers and snow.

results.title: Illusions of reality
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Developing image”.
Portrays the public’s belief in the photograph and the ways that this trust has been manipulated over the years. Viewers explore photographs taken at the Battle of Gettysburg with a Civil War historian, while contemporary photographer Duane Michals, discusses illusion in his personal and commercial work.

results.title: Illuminations
results.creator_credit: Tibor Markus, Australia Council and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: A young couple live in an almost hallucinatory world. Through the death of the girl’s father a sense of the infinite develops between them. Their love gives both of them enough self knowledge to become highly alert and sensitive. They become free and detached from the normal anxieties, pressures fears and hopes of society. “Illuminations” makes an attempt at extending consciousness beyond the limits imposed by our ego. Man always underestimates the power of the mind and confuses it with his own man-made illusions. Cast: Gabriella Trsek, Anthony Llewellyn Jones Norman Kaye, Sheila Florence, Athol Smith, Tibor Markus.

results.title: Illuminated lives
results.creator_credit: Margaret Pettigrew, ONF | NFB and Ellen Besen
results.brief_description: This vivid animation re-creates scenes of women at work in the meadows, markets and castles of yesteryear. It lifts women’s lives out of the anonymity of the Middle Ages and shows that then, as now, women of all classes performed a variety of tasks and played a dynamic role in society. The film was inspired by actual medieval illuminations, the painted pictures and ornate letters and designs used to decorate handwritten books of the period. It reflects the vibrant colour and naive style of perspective typical of such medieval art. The music, also inspired by the era, is performed on authentic period instruments.

results.title: Illness in old age
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Vintage Years”.
The Geriatric Unit of the Cowley Road Hospital, Oxford, emphasise cure rather than just keeping the elderly in an institution. Includes a day hospital for the convalescent. Doctor Lionel Cosin, a pioneer in this field, explains how the hospital carries out its work.

results.title: Illegally yours
results.creator_credit: Crescent Moon, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation and Peter Bogdanovich
results.brief_description: This is the off-beat story of Richard Dice (Rob Lowe), a college dropout who comes back home only to find himself on jury duty in the trial of his high school-sweetheart, Molly (Colleen Camp), who is charged with murder. Convinced she’s been framed, he sets out to prove her innocence - only things don’t go according to plan when he finds himself the target of a band of crazy thugs; shady conspirators; millionaires; jurors; judges and the police. But really, what’s a little perjury, blackmail, burglary and murder among friends.

results.title: Illegal abortion
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Robin Spry
results.brief_description: A dramatization that illustrates the situation of a young couple, particularly of the young woman, faced with an unwanted pregnancy and desiring an abortion forbidden by law. The film portrays her dilemma from the time the pregnancy is confirmed by her doctor to the harrowing moments in a back room where it is terminated by an illegal practitioner. Photographed by Robert Nichol. Edited by Roy Ayton Sound by Victor Merrill. Cast includes: Sabina Fircks, Frank Heron, Elaine Ives Cameron, Ken James, Bill Lynn, Walter Massey, Vladimir Rajewsky, David Schurmann
